page.title: 15THE BEACH, CARNOUSTIE, part2
page.content: The{fish}in the pools are also quite numerous. There are{Gobies, Blennies, {Sticklebacks, Lumpsuckers}and {Sea-scorpions.} The{seaweed}is mostly {Bladder Wrack,}whose bubble-like formations make a delightful popping sound when pressed by fingers. Many types of{birds}can also be seen feeding on the shore when the tide is out. The main{waders}are the{Curlews in winter and the{Oyster-catchers which specialise in{mussel-bashing. Although 9 species of{gull}can be seen, the{Herring Gull}is the most common. The commonest{duck}is the{Eider, indeed some 20-30,000 of them winter in the area, making it the largest winter flock in Europe.
